channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Urgent Request for Leaf Clearance on Our Street, 3rd November
item.description:
I’m writing to bring to council’s attention the current state of our street, which is lined with poplar trees that are now shedding their leaves for autumn. The pavements have become heavily covered with fallen leaves, creating both an unsightly mess and a potential slipping hazard for pedestrians, especially in wet conditions. Could the council please arrange for urgent sweeping and maintenance to clear the leaves and ensure the pavements are safe for everyone? Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thurlby Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zebra crossing light off, 3rd November
item.description:
One side of the zebra crossing has no lights - neither the flashing amber light nor the lamp to light the people beneath are working and this is dangerous given how early it gets dark now.

item.title: Please clean the slippery compressed leaf detritus in the Council owned carriageway part of Mays Hill Rd, Shortlands near the junction with the housing association estate road Colebrook Rise., 3rd November
item.description:
Please clean the slippery compressed leaf detritus in the Council owned carriageway part of Mays Hill Rd, Shortlands near the junction with the housing association estate road Colebrook Rise. The slippery, vehicle-compressed and rain sodden mess is where pedestrians using the Mays Hill Rd public footway cross that part of the Council carriageway to continue their progress. Just to be clear: the hazard is on council land, not housing association land.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colebrook Rise, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electrical recycling bin causing fly tipping, 3rd November
item.description:
As usual this bin is surrounded by electrical equipment that won’t fit into it. I approve of course of the principle of recycling electricals but this bin just encourages fly tipping. Provide one big enough for microwave ovens maybe?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Kent Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging basal growth from the residential beech tree at the front of 7 and 8 Beech Tree Court maisonettes in Shortlands Rd at the junction with Valley Rd, Shortlands, 3rd November
item.description:
Overhanging basal growth from the residential beech tree at the front of 7 and 8 Beech Tree Court maisonettes in Shortlands Rd at the junction with Valley Rd: This is hazardously blocking or restricting the intervisibility between pedestrians approaching the island crossing and often fast moving vehicles approaching the junction, but seeing pedestrians only at the last moment. Please secure the pruning of basal growth of the Beech tree overhanging the public footway and a general narrowing of the footway with leaves and soil.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regularly parks on double yellow & idles engine, 3rd November
item.description:
Towing truck regularly parks on double yellow lines near corner of Datchworth Court and Queen's Drive. The engine is sometimes left running. Tried speaking to him once, became quite aggressive.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London

item.title: Blocking street light over zebra crossing, 3rd November
item.description:
Large trees are blocking a street light that is located to light a zebra crossing. As such the zebra crossing is very dark and difficult to see pedestrians at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 308, Erith Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nicky’s chippy rubbish, 3rd November
item.description:
Micky’s chippy’s rubbish is put on the corner of Pellerin and Boleyn Road. There is so much after Saturday night and it has been pulled apart by foxes and is all over the street. It’s completely disgusting. It’s been going on too long

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
